question: 休学
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>rest</kanji> from <kanji>school</kanji> you are taking an <vocabulary>absence from school</vocabulary>. This is only for very long absences though, not a day or a week, but months or years. Think about it like taking an extended leave of absence from school.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
